page.title: 14FARMING & EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Deciduous trees ie oak, ash, beech chestnut and coniferous pines are planted in small specie blocks to be cut and sold for furniture and paper pulp.Rare pines have also been planted for ornamental purposes {EMPLOYMENT}The area has traditionally relied upon farming, sand and gravel quarrying, lead mining and brick manufacture as a major source of employment. Now only farming, the Rhosesmor Sand and Gravel quarry and the Gwysaney Hall estate provide a limited number of local jobs. New jobs have been created though by new light industries attracted onto the industrial estate, Rhydymwyn, through government concessions and grants, by the more pleasant and cleaner environment,the pool of labour formed through unemployement and the quick link to the motorway system.
